body.p:
War Department,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, D. C., February 3rd 1864.
His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky,
Frankfort. Ky.
Sir,
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 25th ultimo asking the reason of the stoppage of pay against Captain J. M. Hewitt, 2nd Kentucky Battery.

In reply. I am directed to inform you, that Captain Hewitt is charged with retaining in his possession a commission issued by the Governor of the state to Private John W. Walls, as 1st Lieutenant in the Battery. and refusing to deliver the same. thereby depriving Private Walls of his muster into
service as a commissioned officer
The case hase been referred to the proper Commanding General. and is now under consideration.

I am, Sir, Very Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant
Thomas M Vincent
Assistant Adjutant General.
